text: Frederick McCarthy Forsyth (born 25 August 1938) is a British author and former journalist. He is best known for his thriller novels The Day of the Jackal, The Odessa File,The Dogs of War, The Fourth Protocol, The Devil's Alternative, The Fist of God, Icon, The Afghan, The Cobra and The Kill List. He has sold more than 70 million books in total. Forsyth was born in Ashford, Kent. He said in 2016 that he worked as an MI6 spy for over twenty years. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:British military people Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:English journalists Category:English novelists Category:Writers from Kent Category:People from Ashford, Kent
title: Frederick Forsyth
